page.title: 02Ecology of West Chard Area
page.content: The chalk uplands of{Snowdon Hill drain through a series of springs around the S. and E.of the block. To the S.they drain to the R.Kit and thence via the{R.Axe}to the{English {Channel.}To the E.streams run to the R.Ile then the{R.Parrett}and eventually to the{Bristol Channel.} Being in the shadow of the first high ground met by S.W.winds rainfall is high and the area is known to be wet and windy in winter. The rural area has some residual{Oak woodland around ancient hedgerows but many fields are now being amalgamated for convenience of cereal harvesting. Streams, where they exist, are clean and provide some trout fishing but care must be taken to prevent seepage from silage and slurry lagoons.
